intro: Saussurea kungii, commonly known as the Tibetan yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, particularly in regions of Tibet and Nepal. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange-colored flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like. Saussurea kungii is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
